line_1: For delvers, ditchers, an' sic cattle;
line_2: L — d man, our gentry care as little
Some, when th' affair was Blenheim's glorious battle,
Might aiblins waur't thee for a brattle;
But sax Scotch mile, thou try't their mettle,
Nae whip nor spur, but just a wattle

line_1: 'Tis but my due to ride on my own cattle.
line_2: This fine lone hand some of my debts will settle;

line_1: H' has tam'd the most unruly cattle. —
line_2: About his ears how strange a rattle!

line_1: H' has tam'd the most unruly cattle. —
line_2: Who ever stood so tough a battle?
Swith, in some beggar's haffet squattle;
There ye may creep, and sprawl, and sprattle,
Whare horn nor bane ne'er daur unsettle,
